meanings.definition: To make something seem more glamorous or attractive than it really is.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overglamorize her vacation photos on social media.
meanings.sent2: It's important not to overglamorize the challenges of starting a new business.
meanings.sent3: He always overglamorizes his cooking skills, but his burnt toast tells a different story.
meanings.sent4: The movie industry often overglamorizes the life of actors, hiding the struggles behind the scenes.
meanings.sent5: The advertisement overglamorized the benefits of the product, leading to disappointment among customers.

meanings.definition: To exaggerate the attractiveness or importance of something.
meanings.sent1: The author tends to overglamorize the characters in her stories.
meanings.sent2: Politicians sometimes overglamorize their achievements to win votes.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecast overglamorized the sunny day, and it ended up raining heavily.
meanings.sent4: Don't overglamorize the simplicity of the task; it requires careful attention to detail.
meanings.sent5: The artist's paintings overglamorize nature, making it look more magical than it is in reality.
